00004 /*! \file cvm-drv-reqresp.h
00005     \brief Core Driver: PCI instruction response routines.
00006 */
00007 
00008 #ifndef  __CVM_DRV_REQRESP_H__
00009 #define  __CVM_DRV_REQRESP_H__
00010 
00011 
00012 /** Core: This routine is called to post a response to a PCI instruction when 
00013  *  the response will be sent to multiple host buffers. In other words, for
00014  *  scatter mode responses, use this API. The response header (ORH),
00015  *  status of instruction processing, the scatter list containing the host
00016  *  buffer addresses are passed to this function in a cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t
00017  *  structure. The response data and pointer to the raw instruction for which
00018  *  the response is being sent are passed as params. The function can be
00019  *  called in blocking/non-blocking mode. For non-blocking mode, it takes
00020  *  a pointer to a work queue entry which is scheduled in the POW when the
00021  *  DMA completes.
00022  *
00023  *  @param  action - specify DMA_BLOCKING/DMA_NON_BLOCKING
00024  *  @param  wqe    - For non-blocking mode, a pointer to a work queue entry
00025  *                   is passed here.
00026  *  @param  resp   - pointer to a cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t structure which
00027  *                   contains the scatter list, status & response header
00028  *  @param  lptr   - the local pointer to  response data.
00029  *  @param  local_segs   - number of local data segments in response data.
00030  *  @param  ptr_type - type of pointer for "lptr" (DIRECT/LINKED/GATHER)
00031  *
00032  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: -ENOMEM, -EINVAL. 
00033  */
00034 int
00035 cvm_drv_send_scatter_response(DMA_ACTION              action,
00036                               cvmx_wqe_t             *wqe,
00037                               cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t *resp,
00038                               cvmx_buf_ptr_t          lptr,
00039                               uint32_t                local_segs,
00040                               cvm_ptr_type_t          ptr_type);
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048 /** Core: This routine is called to post a response to a PCI instruction when 
00049  *  the response will be sent to multiple host buffers. In other words, for
00050  *  scatter mode responses, use this API. The response header (ORH) and
00051  *  status of instruction processing are assumed to be part of the response
00052  *  data passed to this function. The scatter list containing the host
00053  *  buffer addresses are passed to this function in a cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t
00054  *  structure. The response data and pointer to the raw instruction for which
00055  *  the response is being sent are passed as params. The function can be
00056  *  called in blocking/non-blocking mode. For non-blocking mode, it takes
00057  *  a pointer to a work queue entry which is scheduled in the POW when the
00058  *  DMA completes.
00059  *
00060  *  @param  action - specify DMA_BLOCKING/DMA_NON_BLOCKING
00061  *  @param  wqe    - For non-blocking mode, a pointer to a work queue entry
00062  *                   is passed here.
00063  *  @param  resp   - pointer to a cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t structure which
00064  *                   contains the scatter list. The status & orh fields are
00065  *                   ignored her.
00066  *  @param  lptr   - the local pointer to  response data which includes the
00067  *                   response header (first 8 bytes) and status (last 8 bytes).
00068  *  @param  local_segs   - number of local data segments in response data.
00069  *  @param  ptr_type - type of pointer for "lptr" (DIRECT/LINKED/GATHER)
00070  *
00071  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: -ENOMEM, -EINVAL. 
00072  */
00073 int
00074 cvm_drv_send_scatter_response_direct(DMA_ACTION              action,
00075                                      cvmx_wqe_t             *wqe,
00076                                      cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t *resp,
00077                                      cvmx_buf_ptr_t          lptr,
00078                                      uint32_t                local_segs,
00079                                      cvm_ptr_type_t          ptr_type);
00080 
00081 
00082 
00083 
00084 
00085 /** Core: Read a scatter list from the host memory.
00086  *
00087  *  @param  action - specify DMA_BLOCKING/DMA_NON_BLOCKING
00088  *  @param  host_hw_addr - Host memory address of scatter list
00089  *  @param  front - pointer to the PCI instruction.
00090  *  @param  sptr - address of local buffer to read in  the scatter list.
00091  *  @param  wqe    - For non-blocking mode, a pointer to a work queue entry
00092  *                   is passed here.
00093  *  @return Success:0 Failure: non-zero error value
00094  */
00095 int
00096 cvm_drv_read_scatter_list(DMA_ACTION          action,
00097                           uint64_t            host_hw_addr,
00098                           cvmx_raw_inst_front_t   *front,
00099                           octeon_sg_entry_t  *sptr,
00100                           cvmx_wqe_t         *wqe);
00101 
00102 
00103 
00104 
00105 /** Core: This routine is called to post a response to a PCI instruction when 
00106  *  the response will be sent to a single host buffer. The response data and
00107  *  pointer to the raw instruction for which the response is being sent are
00108  *  passed as params. The response header & status of instruction processing 
00109  *  are assumed to be part of the response data.
00110  *  The function can be called in blocking/non-blocking mode. For non-blocking
00111  *  mode, it takes a pointer to a work queue entry which is scheduled in the
00112  *  POW when the DMA completes.
00113  *
00114  *  @param  action - specify DMA_BLOCKING/DMA_NON_BLOCKING
00115  *  @param  front  - the RAW instruction from where the return address and
00116  *                   IRH are read.
00117  *  @param  lptr   - the local pointer to  response data.
00118  *  @param  segs   - number of local data segments in response data.
00119  *  @param  ptr_type - type of pointer for "lptr" (DIRECT/LINKED/GATHER)
00120  *  @param  wqe    - For non-blocking mode, a pointer to a work queue entry
00121  *                   is passed here.
00122  *
00123  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: -ENOMEM, -EINVAL. 
00124  */
00125 int
00126 cvm_drv_pci_instr_response_direct(DMA_ACTION               action,
00127                                   cvmx_raw_inst_front_t   *front,
00128                                   cvmx_buf_ptr_t           lptr,
00129                                   uint32_t                 segs,
00130                                   cvm_ptr_type_t           ptr_type,
00131                                   cvmx_wqe_t              *wqe);
00132 
00133 
00134 /** Core: This routine is called to post a response to a PCI instruction when 
00135  *  the response will be sent to a single host buffer. The response header,
00136  *  status of instruction processing, the response data and pointer to the raw
00137  *  instruction for which the response is being sent are passed as params.
00138  *  The function can be called in blocking/non-blocking mode. For non-blocking
00139  *  mode, it takes a pointer to a work queue entry which is scheduled in the
00140  *  POW when the DMA completes.
00141  *
00142  *  @param  action - specify DMA_BLOCKING/DMA_NON_BLOCKING
00143  *  @param  front  - the RAW instruction from where the return address and
00144  *                   IRH are read.
00145  *  @param  orh    - The response header.
00146  *  @param  status - status of instruction processing.
00147  *  @param  lptr   - the local pointer to  response data.
00148  *  @param  segs   - number of local data segments in response data.
00149  *  @param  ptr_type - type of pointer for "lptr" (DIRECT/LINKED/GATHER)
00150  *  @param  wqe    - For non-blocking mode, a pointer to a work queue entry
00151  *                   is passed here.
00152  *
00153  *  @return Success: 0; Failure: -ENOMEM, -EINVAL. 
00154  */
00155 
00156 int
00157 cvm_drv_pci_instr_response(DMA_ACTION              action,
00158                            cvmx_raw_inst_front_t  *front,
00159                            cvmx_resp_hdr_t        *orh,
00160                            uint64_t                status,
00161                            cvmx_buf_ptr_t          lptr,
00162                            uint32_t                segs,
00163                            cvm_ptr_type_t          ptr_type,
00164                            cvmx_wqe_t             *wqe);
00165

00167 
00168 /** Core: cvm_dma_send_scatter_response_direct() existed in older releases and
00169  *        may be removed from future releases. The new function
00170  *        cvm_drv_send_scatter_response_direct() uses the uniform naming
00171  *        convention used for all core driver API. 
00172  */
00173 static inline int
00174 cvm_dma_send_scatter_response_direct(DMA_ACTION              action,
00175                                      cvmx_wqe_t             *wqe,
00176                                      cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t *resp,
00177                                      cvmx_buf_ptr_t          lptr,
00178                                      uint32_t                local_segs,
00179                                      cvm_ptr_type_t          ptr_type)
00180 {
00181     return cvm_drv_send_scatter_response_direct(action, wqe, resp, lptr, local_segs, ptr_type);
00182 }
00183 
00184 
00185 /** Core: cvm_dma_send_scatter_response() existed in older releases and
00186  *        may be removed from future releases. The new function
00187  *        cvm_drv_send_scatter_response() uses the uniform naming
00188  *        convention used for all core driver API. 
00189  */
00190 static inline int
00191 cvm_dma_send_scatter_response(DMA_ACTION              action,
00192                               cvmx_wqe_t             *wqe, 
00193                               cvm_pci_scatter_resp_t *resp,
00194                               cvmx_buf_ptr_t          lptr,
00195                               uint32_t                local_segs,
00196                               cvm_ptr_type_t          ptr_type)
00197 {
00198     return cvm_drv_send_scatter_response(action, wqe, resp, lptr, local_segs, ptr_type);
00199 }
